question_stem: A rectangular piece of metal has a length of (2x + 5) cm and a width of (3x - 1) cm. A square with side length x cm is cut out from each corner.  The resulting area of the metal is 15 cm².

parts.question_text: Find the possible values of x.
parts.solution_text:
The area of the original rectangle is given by (2x+5)(3x-1) = 6x² + 13x - 5 cm².
The area of the four squares cut out is 4x².
The remaining area is given by (6x² + 13x - 5) - 4x² = 2x² + 13x - 5.
We are told this area is 15 cm², so we set up the equation:
2x² + 13x - 5 = 15
2x² + 13x - 20 = 0
We can solve this quadratic equation by factorising:
(2x - 5)(x + 4) = 0
So the possible values of x are x = \frac{5}{2} or x = -4.
Since x represents a length, it must be positive, so x = \frac{5}{2} cm.
